Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Synergistic sieving via pore size and polar ─NH2 groups

Other Information.Additional Info: ─NH2 groups facilitate desolvation by reducing energy barriers.
Higher adsorption energy compared to other MOFs.

Sieving Mechanism: Capture-then-sieving mechanism facilitated by ─NH2 polar groups.

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiment, GCMC simulation, in situ SFG spectroscopy, TOF-SIMS, XPS
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Li+ transference number: 0.71; Capacity retention: 90.5% over 300 cycles at 0 °C; Cycling stability: >2000 h at 0.5 mA cm−2

Other Information.Additional Info: NH2-MIL-125 promotes uniform Li deposition and suppresses dendrite formation under low-temperature conditions.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Passive-acting desolvation affected by electric field

Other Information.Additional Info: Less efficient desolvation compared to NH2-MIL-125 due to absence of polar ─NH2 groups.
Lower adsorption energy compared to NH2-MIL-125.

Sieving Mechanism: Passive-acting desolvation driven by electric field.

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiment, GCMC simulation, TOF-SIMS, XPS
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Li+ transference number: 0.46; Cycling stability: ~170 cycles at 1 mA cm−2

Other Information.Additional Info: MIL-125 shows inferior performance in promoting uniform Li deposition and suppressing dendrites compared to NH2-MIL-125.
Better sieving effect than MIL-125 but less efficient than NH2-MIL-125.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion via smaller pore morphology.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Li+ transference number: 0.64; Cycling stability: ~330 cycles at 1 mA cm−2

Other Information.Additional Info: ZIF-67 exhibits better desolvation kinetics than MIL-125 but lacks the active-acting desolvation mechanism of NH2-MIL-125.
Better sieving effect than MIL-125 but less efficient than NH2-MIL-125.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion via smaller pore morphology.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Li+ transference number: 0.55; Cycling stability: ~260 cycles at 1 mA cm−2

Other Information.Additional Info: ZIF-8 exhibits better desolvation kinetics than MIL-125 but lacks the active-acting desolvation mechanism of NH2-MIL-125.
